briefdescription.para: ID of the direct parent.
Parent Transform.
All the children that an entity has.
Returns the total number of children, from all of the generations.
Returns the total number of children, from all of the generations, that are active.
Returns the total number of children, from all of the generations, that are enabled.
Returns the total number of children, from all of the generations, that are enabled and active.
Sets the position of the object in Local Coordintes, so relative to its parent.
Sets the position of the object in Local Coordintes, so relative to its parent.
Returns the position relative to its parent.
Translates the current position by an amount. It is not the same as setPosition.

parameterdescription.para: The direction it is moving to.

briefdescription.para: Translates the current position by an amount. It is not the same as setPosition.

parameterdescription.para: Direction in x it is moving to
Direction in y it is moving to

briefdescription.para: Sets the rotation of the entity in Local value.
Returns the rotation relative to its parent.
Rotates the entity by an amount of degrees. It is not the same as setRotation.
Sets the scale of the entity in Local value.
Sets the scale of the entity in Local value.
Returns the scale relative to its parent.
Adds an amount to the current scale. It is not the same as setScale.

parameterdescription.para: The amount to increase or decrease the scale.

briefdescription.para: Adds an amount to the current scale. It is not the same as setScale.

parameterdescription.para: The amount to increase/decrease the scale in x
The amount to increase/decrease the scale in y

briefdescription.para: Returns the position of the Node in world coordinates. This is useful when the Node you need the position is a child of other Node and you need the position relative to the world and not the parent (which getPosition() gives).

Returns the scale of the Node in world units. This is useful when the Node you need the scale is a child of other Node and you need the scale relative to the world and not the parent (which getScale() gives).

Returns the rotation of the Node in world degrees units. This is useful when the Node you need the rotation is a child of other Node and you need the rotation relative to the world and not the parent (which getRotation() gives).
Sets the position of the Node in world coordinates.
Translates the position of the Node in world coordinates units.
Sets the rotation of the Node in world degrees.
Component common to every entity that tells the engine where it is, which scale it has and how much it is rotated.
